title: Dear League community, attention please!
body:
**Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green Zyra's skin is green **

#Thank you for your attention.

replies.body: Do you mean in game or on the splash? I cant get in game right now cause I am on mobile, but her splash skin is definately more yellow than green. Some of her "clothes" are green, but her skin isn't.

In fact it's green. The splash uses red/orange lightning so it looks different, but in fact it's green. You can see it on the model and in A New Dawn cinematic. 

The point of this post is that people are using a normal human skin shade in fanarts and cosplays because they don't know or are lazy.

I just pulled up A New Dawn, a custom game where I was Zyra, and the LoLking model viewer and I can 100% guarantee you that Zyra is human color with a slight yellow tint.

You are either crazy, trolling, or colorblind.
You are colorblind if you can't tell yellow and apple green apart, lol
She looks a hint of yellow to me.
